title: Girlfriend pays tribute to boy, 12, killed on live rail tracks with Rihanna lyrics
text:

The devastated girlfriend of a schoolboy who was killed on train tracks has paid an emotional tribute to him, using some of Rihanna 's lyrics.

The 12-year-old, named locally as James, died instantly from electrocution at around 7pm.

In a touching tribute to the tragic youngster, flowers were taken to the scene by the mum of his 14-year-old girlfriend, the Liverpool Echo reports.

The girl's parent shared the touching tribute.

It read: "Shine bright like a diamond.

"You were the happiest little boy.

"You will be missed. By your girl."

(Image: Julian Hamilton/Daily Mirror)

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

Friends who knew James well described him as an "amazing lad whose smile would light up the room."

One said: "He was always so polite.

"He was a bouncy little lad."

Locals said James had got onto the railway with another young boy, also said to be 12.

One adult said: "His friend tried to get over to help him."

James' girlfriend was said to be "so shocked," her family said.

(Image: Liverpool Echo)

The friends described themselves as "devastated and heartbroken."

Another card was left at the scene, which read: “A golden heart stopped beating.

“Two shining eyes closed tight.

“Goodnight god Bless you beautiful boy.

"Thinking of all your family. GBNF.”

(Image: LIVERPOOL ECHO)

On the same card was the message: “Going to miss you mate. Why would you do such a thing?"

“Going to miss you bro."

This morning, British Transport Police, who are probing the tragedy, said: "Officers were called to the line in Bootle shortly after 7pm last night following reports of a casualty on the tracks.

"Paramedics also attended however sadly a person was pronounced dead at the scene.

"The incident is not being treated as suspicious and a file will be prepared for the coroner.”

An emergency switch-off of the tracks was requested by British Transport Police (BTP) who rushed to deal with the incident.

The stretch from Sandhills to Waterloo was isolated as workers rushed to reach the body.

Track staff attended the scene to inspect fencing around the area where the boy made his way onto the line.

Rail services were suspended between Sandhills and Hall Road while emergency services investigated the incident.

Officials from Network Rail could be seen this morning at the scene.
description: The young boy died in Bootle, Liverpool last night after getting onto the railway line, where he was electrocuted
